managementResponses.response: Thank you Ashley for your stay and review.  We are excited that you had a comfortable stay and found the benefits of the hotels location.  Good advice for those wondering if they need a car in SF.  It makes more sense to use public transposition.  Thank you again and we hope to see you in the future.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the BART
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel. Friendly staff, nice room, comfortable bed. Good location too (near the Embarcado stop for BART). We booked this on Expedia and it exceeded our expectations. One thing to note is in and out parking is $36 + tax per day so we decided to just turn in the rental car early and take BART. Also, the room is sort of small but comfortable for two people. I didn't feel cramped or anything but it was not as spacious as other hotels. Overall, I'd come back and stay again though!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your stay.  There are bottles water stations in the guest corridors that are complimentary to our guests on floors 2-8 by the elevators.  The bottles are provided and guest have unlimited use.  I'm sorry that you did not find them.

review.title: No bottled water in the room!
review.reviewText: No bottled water in the room, not even in the fridge...

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your stay.  I'm happy that you liked the restaurant.  I will share your comments with them.  I don't know which room you stayed in, but we have four sizes of rooms.  The Superiors and Suites are much larger than the Club or Standard sizes.  Hopefully we have have you stay with nus again in a larger room.  

Thank you again.

review.reviewText: Not a huge room but for being where it was at a good price I can't complain. Fish and Farm next door is really where I had my best time. : )

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your stay with us.  We appreciate you taking the time to review us on Expedia.  PLease note that we do have larger rooms.  I would suggest a Superior or Suite next time as they are good sized rooms.

review.reviewText: My room was too small. If you're not claustrophobic you'll be fine for a weekend stay. The price was right, and the location was great. This hotel is located in a central location with many sites, restaurants and shopping nearby.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for staying with us Reid and for reviewing us on Expedia.  We certainly do hope to see you again in the future.  All the best.

review.title: Great for business - a nice work lounge downstairs
review.reviewText:
Overall, it was a comfortable hotel, awesome restaurant below - with an area that makes getting work done easy. 
I come to SF for work a lot, I will likely come back.

review.title: Very rude staff, not helpful at all.
review.reviewText: Not good! Staff was very rude. I deserve a full refund! They made are staying unwelcome.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to complete the Booking.com guest survey. I am so delighted to see that you enjoyed your stay with us here at Club Quarters, and that our entire staff was able to provide you with attentive and friendly service.

If you have an extra moment and would like to help be a part of our property's continued success, we would love your feedback from this stay at www.tripadvisor.com!

I truly appreciate your continued patronage of Club Quarters Hotels, and I am looking forward to welcoming you back in the future.  

Kind regards,

Patrick Jackson - Hotel Manager

review.reviewText: This was our second stay in a Club Quarters Hotel, the first being in their New York Central Station outpost. Although for us it does not score as highly as Central Station we were more than happy with our room and the hotel in general. The staff were all polite and attentive and more than happy to help when required. Really good location for exploring San Francisco with Chinatown, Little Italy, Union Square within close walking distance. I would recommend this chain of hotels to anyone and would certainly use them again as I could trust there to be a high standard.

Great location but very noisy. The walls were thin and one side of the building is against an alley way.
Rooms are small but clean. Nice amenity to have coffee and water supplied. Housekeeping kept forgetting there were 2 people staying in the room and did not supply enough towels.

review.title: Good, central location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed staying here- the location was very central and felt safe. Reasonably priced parking garage across the street. Staff were friendly and helpful. Self check-in and check-out was easy and efficient. The only con was that the room was on the small side, but we hardly spent any time there, so it wasn't a big deal for us.

Great location
And staff is very nice
I like the room

review.title: Good choice in Financial District
review.reviewText: It was a great experience except that you have to pay 34 dollars per night for parking and there is no cheaper way in financial district. The rooms are a little bit smaller than I expected because of its location. However it is very safe and urban.  Youngsters will love it. It's location is close to Lombart stress my and Golden Gate Bridge. Will stay again !

review.title: old hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine but dated and old. It seemed more like a building that was originally apartments. It felt like a college dorm. Nowhere near a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Not far from Golden Gate Bridge
review.reviewText: Regular room was too small and we had to upgrade it by paying $25.
review.positiveRemarks: Availability of water, soft drinks, Coffee, and nibbles all day in the lobby.

review.title: Quick Trip to the City
review.reviewText: I went to SF to meet with an old friend for the day. The hotel was centrally located for all of my needs including transportation, coffee, food, and activities. The hotel was designed for business people so amenities included Wifi and access to office machines (copier, fax, computer, etc), perfect for my daughter taking summer college courses. Overall, the room was small but comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly and helpful. The location allowed me to walk to wherever I needed to go or had easy access to transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: The in room coffee could be better.
review.locationRemarks: The location was in the financial district. The hotel was within walking distance to China Town, The Ferry Building, a park, shopping, and restaurants

review.title: Better than most chain hotels.
review.reviewText: I was a bit reluctant to stay at any downtown hotel that was not a chain hotel, but I followed previous reviews about this hotel (CQ) and they were very accurate. Very centrally located to all SF tourist destinations. EZ walk to ferry bldg, BART station, trolley, wharf and piers 33 & 39, and Chinatown. You can also catch the 'BigBus' tour across the street too. Of course, there was a Starbucks in the same building so that was a 'bonus' for the wife. The hotel was always very clean. It was never too busy that you couldn't get an elevator, though, the key car feature for the elevators needs some improvement; most people had difficulty with it, including us. Rooms are a all bit small, so I would recommend you upgrade to the 'suite' like we did if you can. All in all a fantastic hotel and we would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was always very friendly and responsive, the hotel was very centrally located to all of the normal San Francisco tourist destinations.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators required your room key to go up and most people, including us, had trouble with that.
review.locationRemarks: Very centrally located to all SF tourist destinations. EZ walk to ferry bldg, BART station, trolley, wharf and piers 33 & 39, and Chinatown.

review.reviewText: Great room, good location... would stay there again!

review.title: Great hotel, close to the pier and market.
review.reviewText: Got to check in early, everyone was friendly, great location

review.title: Great location for business travelers
review.reviewText: I stayed overnight and appreciated how the hotel makes it easy for business travelers to stay. Wifi was good, large shower (no bath, FYI), quiet room, and great location kitty corner from the Embarcadero Center. It's several minutes walk from BART. I'd happily stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was somewhat small, but to be expected given the location.
review.locationRemarks: The area is ideal for people doing business in the financial district.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very clean.  The only problem, I could hear my neighbor very well.  Had to change rooms.  The staff was very accommodating, she gave me a much nicer room.  I slept very well. I will stay there again.  The price was very affordable.

review.title: Lisa does it right by the bay
review.reviewText: We stayed very last minute and were pleasantly impress wirh the location and the ease to check on and out, they also made it vey easy to find where to park and held our luggage for the day
